articleContent.title: Chord: 6th in D (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 6th in D (Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The 6th chord in D (Shape: D) is a versatile and beautiful-sounding chord voicing that can add depth and richness to your chord progressions. This particular voicing places the 6th note of the D major scale as the highest note in the chord, creating a warm and melodic sound.

## Notes and Intervals
The 6th chord in D consists of the following notes:
- D (Root)
- F# (3rd)
- A (5th)
- B (6th)

This chord is built by taking the root (D), major 3rd (F#), perfect 5th (A), and major 6th (B) notes of the D major scale.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 6th chord in D (Shape: D) is often used in various genres such as folk, country, pop, and rock music. It adds a sense of warmth and sweetness to chord progressions, providing a melodic and uplifting quality to the music. This chord voicing is commonly used in acoustic settings to create a pleasant and harmonious sound.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the 6th chord in D (Shape: D):
1. "Landslide" by Fleetwood Mac - This iconic song features the 6th chord in D throughout the chord progression, adding a sense of nostalgia and emotion to the music.
2. "Ho Hey" by The Lumineers - The 6th chord in D is used in this indie folk hit to create a catchy and uplifting sound that resonates with listeners.
3. "Wagon Wheel" by Old Crow Medicine Show - This bluegrass-inspired song prominently features the 6th chord in D, contributing to its rootsy and authentic musical flavor.
